name: System Compromise – Containment
description:
# 💻 System Compromise – Containment
---
## 🎯 Usage
Rapidly apply the different measures to:  
- **Freeze the situation**  
- **Prevent lateral movement**  
- **Secure backups**  
- **Preserve traces**  
---
## ⚙️ Prerequisites
- **Prior qualification**: incident confirmed as system compromise, severity assessed.  
  → *Reflex sheet – System Compromise – Qualification*.  
  → If ransomware suspicion → also consult *Encryption/deletion – Qualification* and *Containment* sheets.  
- **Administration capabilities**: IT rights available or outsourcing provider available.  
- **Active attacker presence**: avoid interactive sessions (local/RDP/SSH).  
  →  Prefer **EDR**, otherwise physical/out-of-band console.  
  →  As last resort: PowerShell Remoting, WinRS or RDP Restricted Admin.  
---
## 📌 Objectives
#### ✅ Limit the extension of the compromise
1. Freeze the situation  
2. Reset user credentials suspected of being compromised  
3. Reset secrets linked to the infected machine
#### ✅ Preserve the organization's essential assets
4. Secure up-to-date backups 
#### ✅ Preserve traces 
5. Preserve traces on infected machines  
6. Preserve logs  
---
## 📄 Resource
👉 [Complete reflex sheet – PDF](https://www.intercert-france.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/fichereflexe-compromissionsysteme-endiguement.pdf)

tasks.title: Measure 6 - Preserve equipment logs
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Keep the **network/security history** for investigation.

### 📌 Actions

* Controlled export of logs from:

  * **firewall**
  * **proxy**
  * **VPN**
  * **EDR**
  * **IDS/IPS**
* Centralize and lock the exports
* Preserve authentication log traces

### ✅ Deliverables

* Archived log set
* List of exported logs documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 2 - Reset user credentials & related secrets
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
Remove adversarial **access**.
### 📌 Actions
- Disable all user accounts suspected of being compromised
- Reset potentially compromised **accounts** (privileged first), revoke **sessions**
- Rotate **secrets** linked to infected hosts (API keys, certificates, SSH keys)
- Reset cloud accounts
- Revoke sessions of accounts used on the infected machine
- Delete SSH keys
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Access sanitized
+ Log in the **activities** of this task the actions performed.

tasks.title: Measure 3 - Reset secrets associated with the infected machine
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Remove all secrets/access linked to the machine.

### 📌 Actions

* Revoke the certificates of the infected machine.
* Reset tokens or API keys present on accounts of compromised endpoints.
* If the compromised machine is joined to an Active Directory:

  * Disable the machine account in Active Directory.

### ✅ Deliverables

* Secrets reset
* Document the reset secrets in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 4 - Secure up-to-date backups
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Preserve backups to restore services in case of a destructive incident. They may also be used for incident investigation.

### 📌 Actions

* Secure up-to-date backups
* Backups: protect **backup servers/storage**, *snapshots*; disconnect media if necessary
* Validate functional access to backups

### ✅ Deliverables

* Backups secured for recovery
* List of secured backups recorded in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Containment closure & remediation plan
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Move to **remediation** and reinforced monitoring.

### 📌 Actions

* Confirm signal extinction, **stabilization**
* List remediations (patching, hardening, IAM, segmentation) + **monitoring** for X days

### ✅ Deliverables

Containment closure note + remediation backlog

tasks.title: Measure 1 - Freeze the situation
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective
**Cut off** attacker's command & control and **stabilize** the host.
### 📌 Actions
- Interrupt the activity of the infected machine
  ▶ If the infected machine does not carry a system with high availability requirements
  - If VM: **pause**; if physical: **extended sleep** if possible
  - As last resort: controlled shutdown (if isolation impossible) **after** rapid collection if available (including memory)
- Network-level isolation of infected zones from the rest of the information system
  - **Network isolation** via EDR or equipment (L2/L3/WAF/Proxy); cut flows **in both directions**
  - Isolate particularly sensitive zones if the infected machine was accessing them
### ✅ Deliverables
+ Frozen state + isolated perimeter
+ Log in the **activities** of this task the actions performed.

tasks.title: Measure 5 - Preserve traces on infected machines
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Keep the **evidence** without altering it.

### 📌 Actions

▶ If the infected machine is a virtual machine

* Take a snapshot of the virtual machine (already paused) and export it to a dedicated offline disk

  * **Warning**: ensure the memory export is included in the snapshot when available

▶ Otherwise, if the infected machine is a physical machine

* Perform forensic collection

  * using the EDR
  * via a forensic agent
  * via administration service
  * or by manually running a collection tool

### ✅ Deliverables

* Evidence exported and secured
* Record the actions performed in the **activities** of this task
